alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Rush (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Rush and northeastern Decatur Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 414 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rushville, or 16 miles east of Shelbyville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Rush and northeastern Decatur Counties, including the following locations... Glenwood, Milroy, Moscow and New Salem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
